description.narrative: The Global Expertise Teams (GETs) are cross-regional teams that focus on knowledge development and the linking and learning throughout the network for the four different intervention levels: Good Practices, Supportive Business Ecosystems, Enabling Policy Environment and Market Uptake. They are supported by communities of practitioners organized around commodity value chains like palm oil or or coffee and thematic issues like labour or fair value distribution. This structure is network-wide and goes beyond the specific programmes. The GET SBE had limited implementation capacity in 2021. The appointed leaders developed the strategic plans and identified the team members. Due to Covid-19 travel restrictions all mapping of existing experience, study and meetings to identify the leading issues and questions had to go through digital means. The first versions of the plans were presented for approval in Q3 but the board of directors sent them back to the drawing-room to obtain more focus. Our GET leader of Supportive Business Ecosystems had to limit his leading activities to planning the SBE strategic and annual programming.
